intro: Hemizonia glomerata, commonly known as the clustered hemizonia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its small, yellow flowers bloom in clusters, and it is known for its ornamental value in gardens. Hemizonia glomerata is also valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators.
